radiographic_examinations.findings: Appendix measures 7 mm in diameter with mild surrounding fat stranding, mildly hyperemic with a focus of air in the distal appendix and possibly a small amount of oral contrast. Clear lung bases, unremarkable heart and pericardium, normal liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, stomach, and small bowel. No hydronephrosis, mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy, perforation, abscess, free fluid in the pelvis, or acute bone abnormality. Sigmoid diverticulosis is present but no evidence of diverticulitis.
